xxl.core.collections.queues.io

Class StreamQueue<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.collections.queues.AbstractQueue<E>
      • xxl.core.collections.queues.io.StreamQueue<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of the elements of this queue.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Queue<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockBasedQueue, ListStreamQueue, RandomAccessFileQueue

    public abstract class StreamQueue<E>
extends AbstractQueue<E>
    This class provides a queue that uses a data input stream and a data output stream to store its elements. The peek method is not implemented by the stream queue. A converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.

    Implementations of this class must only provide valid implementations for the functions newInputStream and newOutputStream. These functions must implement the functionality of opening an input or output stream on the serialized elements of this queue.

    See Also:
    Queue, AbstractQueue, DataInputStream, DataOutputStream

      The data input stream is used for reading the elements of the queue.
      protected DataOutputStream dataOutputStream
      The data output stream is used for writing elements to the queue.
      static Function FACTORY_METHOD
      A factory method to create a default stream queue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue).
      protected Function<?,Integer> inputBufferSize
      A function that returns the size of the input buffer when it is invoked.
      protected Function<?,? extends InputStream> newInputStream
      A function that opens an input stream for reading the serialized elements of the queue and returns it.
      protected Function<?,? extends OutputStream> newOutputStream
      A function that opens an output stream for writing serialized elements to the queue and returns it.
      protected Function<?,Integer> outputBufferSize
      A function that returns the size of the output buffer when it is invoked.
      protected long unReadInputBuffer
      The number of bytes in the BufferedInputStream which had not been used when the BufferedInputStream was closed.

    • Field Detail

      • FACTORY_METHOD

        public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
        A factory method to create a default stream queue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). This field is set to RandomAccessFileQueue.FACTORY_METHOD.

      • converter

        protected Converter<E> converter
        A converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of this queue.

      • dataInputStream

        protected DataInputStream dataInputStream
        The data input stream is used for reading the elements of the queue.

      • dataOutputStream

        protected DataOutputStream dataOutputStream
        The data output stream is used for writing elements to the queue.

      • newInputStream

        protected Function<?,? extends InputStream> newInputStream
        A function that opens an input stream for reading the serialized elements of the queue and returns it. This method must implement the functionality for opening an input stream on the serialized data of this queue.

      • newOutputStream

        protected Function<?,? extends OutputStream> newOutputStream
        A function that opens an output stream for writing serialized elements to the queue and returns it. This method must implement the functionality for opening an output stream on the serialized data of this queue.

      • inputBufferSize

        protected Function<?,Integer> inputBufferSize
        A function that returns the size of the input buffer when it is invoked. Every time the queue switches (implicitly) from output mode to input mode, the function is invoked in order to determine the size of the input buffer. A function is used instead of an integer to guarantee highest flexibility, i.e. the result of an invocation can depend on the size of the available memory etc.

      • unReadInputBuffer

        protected long unReadInputBuffer
        The number of bytes in the BufferedInputStream which had not been used when the BufferedInputStream was closed. This value is used in subclasses in order to compensate that these unused buffered bytes are lost when switching from input to output stream.

      • outputBufferSize

        protected Function<?,Integer> outputBufferSize
        A function that returns the size of the output buffer when it is invoked. Every time the queue switches (implicitly) from input mode to output mode, the function is invoked in order to determine the size of the output buffer. A function is used instead of an integer to guarantee highest flexibility, i.e. the result of an invocation can depend on the size of the available memory etc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StreamQueue

        protected StreamQueue()
        Default constructor. (For invocation by subclass constructors, typically implicit.)

      • StreamQueue

        public StreamQueue(Converter<E> converter,
                   Function<?,Integer> inputBufferSize,
                   Function<?,Integer> outputBufferSize,
                   Function<?,? extends InputStream> newInputStream,
                   Function<?,? extends OutputStream> newOutputStream)
        Constructs a new stream queue that uses the specified converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and output buffer and opening input and output streams.
        Parameters:
        converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
        inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
        outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.
        newInputStream - a function that opens an input stream for reading the serialized elements of this queue.
        newOutputStream - a function that opens an output stream for writing the serialized elements of this queue.

      • StreamQueue

        public StreamQueue(Converter<E> converter,
                   Function<?,? extends E> newObject,
                   Function<?,Integer> inputBufferSize,
                   Function<?,Integer> outputBufferSize,
                   Function<?,? extends InputStream> newInputStream,
                   Function<?,? extends OutputStream> newOutputStream)
        Constructs a new stream queue that uses the specified converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The factory method is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the output stream is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and output buffer and opening input and output streams.
        This constructor is equivalent to the call of StreamQueue(new UniformConverter(converter, newObject), inputBufferSize, outputBufferSize, newInputStream, newOutputStream).
        Parameters:
        converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
        newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the input stream is read out.
        inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
        outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.
        newInputStream - a function that opens an input stream for reading the serialized elements of this queue.
        newOutputStream - a function that opens an output stream for writing the serialized elements of this queue.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        protected E read()
          throws IOException
        Reads (removes) an object from the queue and returns it.
        This implementation opens the data input stream and reads the object from it by using converter.
        Returns:
        the next element in the queue.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • write

        protected void write(E object)
              throws IOException
        Writes (inserts) an object to the queue.
        This implementation opens the data output stream and writes the object to it by using converter.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be inserted into the queue.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • enqueueObject

        protected void enqueueObject(E object)
        Appends the specified element to the end of this queue.
        This implementation writes (inserts) the object to the queue and increases size.
        Specified by:
        enqueueObject in class AbstractQueue<E>
        Parameters:
        object - element to be appended to the end of this queue.

      • peekObject

        protected E peekObject()
                throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the next element in the queue without removing it. The next element of the queue is given by its strategy.
        This method is invoked by peek and has to implement the peek procedure depending on the strategy and the used datastructure.
        Specified by:
        peekObject in class AbstractQueue<E>
        Returns:
        the next element in the queue.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the peek method is not supported.

      • dequeueObject

        protected E dequeueObject()
        Returns the next element in the queue.
        This implementation reads (removes) the next object from the queue, decreases size and returns the object.
        Specified by:
        dequeueObject in class AbstractQueue<E>
        Returns:
        the next element in the queue.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
        This implementation opens the data input stream and skips over and discards all data from it. Thereafter the data input stream is closed and size is set to 0.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Queue<E>
        Overrides:
        clear in class AbstractQueue<E>

      • openInput

        protected void openInput()
        Opens a data input stream for reading the elements of the queue and sets dataInputStream to it.
        This implementation closes any data output stream on this queue and invokes inputBufferSize. If the result of this invocation is 0, dataInputStream is set to an data input stream wrapping the result of calling the inputStream method. Otherwise the input stream is buffered by using a BufferedInputStream before it is wrapped.

      • closeInput

        protected void closeInput()
        Closes the data input stream on this queue when it is open.

      • openOutput

        protected void openOutput()
        Opens a data output stream for writing elements to the queue and sets dataOutputStream to it.
        This implementation closes any data input stream on this queue and invokes outputBufferSize. When the result of this invocation is 0, dataOutputStream is set to an data output stream wrapping the result of calling the outputStream method. Otherwise the output stream is buffered by using a BufferedOutputStream before it is wrapped.

      • closeOutput

        protected void closeOutput()
        Closes the data output stream on this queue if it is opened.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this queue and releases any system resources associated with it. This operation is idempotent, i.e., multiple calls of this method takes the same effect as a single call.
        This implementation closes the data input stream and data output stream on this queue.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Queue<E>
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractQueue<E>
